meanings.definition: To regard or treat with haughty contempt
meanings.sent1: She disdained the idea of cheating on the test.
meanings.sent2: The queen disdained the beggar's request for help.
meanings.sent3: The cat disdained the new brand of food, turning up its nose at it.
meanings.sent4: His classmates disdained him like he was invisible, never acknowledging his presence.
meanings.sent5: The rich lady disdained the simple lifestyle of the villagers, looking down on their humble ways.

meanings.definition: To refuse or reject with scorn
meanings.sent1: He disdained the offer of a cheap knockoff, preferring quality products.
meanings.sent2: The athlete disdained the use of performance-enhancing drugs.
meanings.sent3: The child disdained the idea of eating broccoli, claiming it was 'yucky'.
meanings.sent4: The artist disdained the use of digital tools, sticking to traditional methods.
meanings.sent5: The teacher disdained plagiarism, emphasizing the importance of original work.

meanings.definition: To look upon or treat with contempt; despise; scorn
meanings.sent1: The bully disdained the smaller kids in the playground, making fun of them.
meanings.sent2: She disdained the gossip spreading around the office, choosing to stay out of it.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater disdained anything green on his plate, pushing it aside.
meanings.sent4: The old man disdained modern technology, preferring the simplicity of the past.
meanings.sent5: The supervisor disdained laziness in the workplace, always pushing for productivity.
